page.title: 06ECOLOGY RAFFORD AREA
page.content: The main type of coniferous tree in the area is Scot's Pine and there are many Norwegian Spruce especially at the edges of the forest areas.The main type of deciduous tree is silver birch and we also found many beech,sycamore and lime.A small number of elm were found. The most common wild flower growing by the roadside is hedge parsley.There is also much gorse and broom and a few white campion and wild poppies.Near streams the most common flowers are cowslip,forget-me-not,bluebells and buttercups. Only 1 grey squirrel,2 rats and about 20 rabbits were seen.We saw 2 rabbits being killed by a farmer with a rifle.Many roe deer were seen in the area.Birds seen were great tit,crow chaffinch,blackbird,a housemarten,a sparrowhawk,a sparrow and woodpigeons.
